title: The physics of saltwater taffy
description: Air bubbles, oil droplets are the primary factors, plus emulsifiers for extra chewiness

title: Everyone should get a COVID booster this fall, CDC says
description: Not everyone is at the same risk, but advisors called for simplicity and equity.

title: RIP to the Microsoft Surface Duo’s support window, an unmitigated disaster
description: The $1,400 device never ran a current version of Android.

title: The iPhone 13 mini is dead, leaving small phone lovers in a lurch
description: One-handed phones are a dying breed. It makes sense, but it's also a bummer.

title: Password-stealing Linux malware served for 3 years and no one noticed
description: It's not too late to check if a Linux device you use was targeted.

title: This student-built EV just set a new world record for 0–62 mph
description: This student-built electric racer needed just 12.3 meters to hit 62 mph.

title: macOS 14 Sonoma will release on September 26, weeks earlier than usual
description: It's the first time a macOS update has released in September since 2018.

title: Judge in US v. Google trial didn’t know if Firefox is a browser or search engine
description: Google accused DOJ of aiming to force people to use “inferior” search products.

title: iOS 17 hits supported devices on September 18
description: StandBy for the new Journaling app (and a lot more).

title: Apple’s new iPhone 15 Pro gets new chips, better cameras, and a titanium frame
description: iPhone 15 Pro still starts at $999, Pro Max at $1,199, available September 22.

title: Apple’s iPhone 15 replaces the notch and switches to USB-C
description: The Dynamic Island makes its way to the non-Pro iPhone, starting at $799.

title: Apple announces the Apple Watch Ultra 2, with a blazing 3,000-nit display
description: It's a modest update spearheaded by a super-bright new display.

title: New Apple Watch Series 9 improves Siri processing, iPhone-finding, and more
description: New models are $399, available Sept. 22, with new "Double Tap" finger gestures.

title: Genomes could help enigmatic, endangered nocturnal parrot make a comeback
description: Variations linked to fertility, survival still present in a small population.

title: US government slams Musk in court filing describing “chaotic environment” at X
description: US says FTC probe uncovered privacy risks caused by Musk's drastic changes.

title: Microsoft will stop accepting new third-party print drivers in Windows
description: Universal standards for print and scan drivers have become more popular.

title: Autonomous truck platoons are a bust, but they work if you put them on rails
description: The ARPA-E backed train from Parallel Systems is now in its second generation.

title: Toxic algae blooms are the new normal as CO2 levels keep rising
description: Ponds, rivers, and lakes all over are getting hit by blooms of blue-green algae.

title: Here’s exactly what Google will argue to fight the DOJ’s antitrust claims
description: 10-week trial probing Google's search business kicks off Tuesday.

title: Intel confirms Thunderbolt 5 name, 120Gbps tech arrives in 2024
description: Thunderbolt 4 expected to be the mainstream choice for at least a couple years.

title: A year after New Shepard’s accident, Blue Origin may return to flight next month
description: New Shepard is scheduled to launch in early October on its return-to-flight mission.
